tasks.task: Operating a 48-inch tiller on a subcompact tractor.
subtasks: Starting the tractor and engaging the PTO.
Attaching the tiller using either the quick hitch or three-point hitch.
Adjusting the slip clutch and skid runner for optimal performance.
Tilling the soil in a single pass, noticing the equipment's depth and coverage.
Comparing the tilling results to previous plowing with an all-purpose plow.
Noting the tiller's performance in terms of seedbed consistency and ease of planting.
Unattaching the tiller and disengaging the PTO.
Starting the tractor and engaging the PTO.
Attaching the plow to the three-point hitch.
Plowing the soil in three passes, adjusting depth and direction as needed.
Noting the challenges and inconsistencies of plowing for seed preparation.
Unattaching the plow and disengaging the PTO.

tasks.task: Assessing and comparing tiller versus plow results.
subtasks: Evaluating the depth, consistency, and relative efficiency of the tiller compared to the plow.
Considering the use of additional tillage passes to improve plow results.

tasks.task: Preparing the seedbed for future planting.
subtasks: Deciding on the appropriate crop and seed variety for the tillage results.
Adjusting planting depth and row spacing.
Applying necessary fertilizers or amendments.

tasks.task: Exploring additional agricultural products and services.
subtasks: Visiting the sponsor's website (Bora Wheel Spacers) for product information.
Learning about National Militarium's screening cover product and planting considerations.
Considering food plot seed options from Northwoods Whitetails.
